function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Commonsense information about environmental conditions may not account for disease transmission factors.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Sharing of links to various websites","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Minimization of danger in route planning","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Promotion of covid-19 route tracking","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High infection rate and asymptomatic infection of covid-19","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unknown and sudden nature of the virus","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in estimating epidemiology parameters in the early stages of the outbreak","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complexity and variation in epidemic models, making it difficult to predict future epidemic situations accurately","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of spatiotemporal description in epidemic models","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incorporation of asymptomatic infectors and environmental infection in dynamic transmission models","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate explanation of mapping between model parameters and practical significance of interventions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neglect of spatial information in modeling epidemic interventions","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for the spatiotemporal evolution of covid-19 in intervention studies","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mode of transmission through close contact","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of mobile phone location data for forecasting epidemics","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Utilization of ecological niche model enm for identifying potential risk zones","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty in obtaining detailed observation data of crowds and resident activity in public health and safety emergencies","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Backtracking problem in current epidemic-related data","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to establish observation strategies and scientific methods aligned with reality in public health emergencies","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of detailed behavior tracking data","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Late and lax epidemic prevention and control measures abroad","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Assumption about the means of transmission of covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Discussion of the status of the spread of covid-19 using early reported case data from the u.k., the u.s., spain, and germany","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Discussion of the potential of quarantine measures, hospital isolation measures, and self-protection measures to alleviate the spread of the epidemic","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Evaluation of the effect of hospital isolation measures based on hospital spatiotemporal distribution","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Global epidemic data collection may have involved exposure to the virus.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of public data repositories for covid-19 information may lead to exposure to malware or cyber threats.","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Change from pcr fluorescence probing to clinical diagnosis without justification","category":"Society","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty and irregular shape of traditional unit for quarantine measures","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Irregular shape and data acquisition difficulty may lead to ineffective grid regions for disease control and prevention.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unrestricted contact between people within the grid boundaries before quarantine implementation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient control over the distribution of the grid may limit the practical scope of quarantine measures.","category":"structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unrestricted contact between people facilitating the spread of covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of quarantine measures allowing unrestricted diffusion of covid-19","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate monitoring and control of infected individuals","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complex spatiotemporal model equations may be prone to errors in implementation and interpretation, leading to inaccurate disease spread predictions.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate understanding of the distribution of infected humans in each grid region may lead to ineffective evaluation of intervention effects.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on quarantine measures, testing, and personal protective equipment without effective assessment of their impact and implications for disease spread.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spatial correlation of human activity and environmental factors affecting transmission of infectious diseases.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of infectious diseases similar to covid-19 starting from adjacent spaces and gradually spreading to surrounding regions.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Need to determine the distribution of infected individuals in each grid region before implementing quarantine measures.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spatial correlation of infectious disease transmission due to people’s living and work locations","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Infection spread from adjacent space to surrounding regions","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission patterns leading to time series change in the number of newly infected people","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spatial weight concept used to calculate newly infected people in grid cells","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Tobler’s first law of geography influencing covid-19 transmission","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complex mathematical equations for calculating infectious grid cell weight","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate implementation of self-protection measures such as wearing face masks, hand washing, and ventilation","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of adherence to maintaining distance from patients with a fever","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate understanding or implementation of effective self-protection measures","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"}]}
